channel.title: Context Engineering Daily
channel.description: Daily news and research updates in AI Context Engineering, Prompt Engineering, RAG, and LLM development

item.title: The Perplexity Paradox: Why Code Compresses Better Than Math in LLM Prompts
item.description: arXiv:2602.15843v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In "Compress or Route?" (Johnson, 2026), we found that code generation tolerates aggressive prompt compression (r >= 0.6) while chain-of-thought reasoning degrades gradually. That study was limited to HumanEval (164 problems), left the "perplexity par...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, chain-of-thought, study, paper, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Can LLMs Assess Personality? Validating Conversational AI for Trait Profiling
item.description: arXiv:2602.15848v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study validates Large Language Models (LLMs) as a dynamic alternative to questionnaire-based personality assessment. item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> retrieval, vector, framework, RAG, knowledge base | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
